metadata.title: CVE-2018-7738 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
In util-linux before 2.32-rc1, bash-completion/umount allows local users togain privileges by embedding shell commands in a mountpoint name, which ismishandled during a umount command (within Bash) by a different user, asdemonstrated by logging in as root and entering umount followed by a tabcharacter for autocompletion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 1:2.34-0.1ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
mount - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
